title: France's Total Exits Myanmar Citing Shareholder Pressure Since Coup; Western energy companies face growing calls to divest or withhold revenue from junta as human-rights situation worsens
text:
TotalEnergies is the largest shareholder and operator of Myanmar's largest natural gas project, an offshore field called Yadana, providing energy for domestic use and export.

The project is a partnership between TotalEnergies, Chevron Corp. and Thailand's PTT Exploration and Production PLC, in partnership with state-owned Myanmar Oil and Gas Enterprise.

Write to Feliz Solomon at feliz.solomon@wsj.com

France's Total Exits Myanmar Citing Shareholder Pressure Since Coup
